urls.title: Environment Agency calls on construction industry to follow duty of care
urls.description: Mishandled rubbish from building sites can be hugely damaging to public health, communities and the environment

tweets.text: Environment Agency calls on construction industry to follow duty of care @EnvAgency - https://t.co/PoVoRXIoXS https://t.co/BFYBU0SVBH

The serious concerns about the felling of Jones Hill Wood must be investigated.  If the Government allowed work to proceed that ignores the laws that protect wildlife, they risk undermining every environmental commitment they have ever made about HS2. @HS2ltd @NaturalEngland https://t.co/SBK6yJ4Dyz

My mum also thought I was being a bit of a drama queen until she got it in the house 2.5 miles away& nearly threw up it was so strong. It’s a major incident @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland You need to act now & evacuate the vulnerable @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/7z6ICMP0fA

Can anyone who reads this sign this petition.If a landfill can be extended by the govt by overriding council decisions then offensive waste snuck on the permit in a town of 139,000 people it can happen to you-WE CANT BREATHE @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @StinkStopthe https://t.co/hbjrjdje8c

The @EnvAgency letter is embarrassing-should have been sent months ago while they actually stopped what has turned into a humanitarian disaster with people’s noses bleeding& exacerbation of asthma, children vomiting. At what point are we evacuated @ClareDinnisEA ? @StinkStopthe https://t.co/TglIq0WPK7

@HMUG_Hackney @KarenShackleto5 @Hillfortian @PymmesBrookERS @StonebridgeLock @RiverChess @Feargal_Sharkey @mayorofhackney @deedeelea @AquiferChalk @RiverActionUK @AnglingTrust @WildTroutTrust @WindrushWasp @ChilternSociety @Chilternstreams @CleanIlkley @RiverBeane @BuryLung @FriendsRib @ReviveTheWye @RachSalv @UnderwaterMedia @suesustainable @DougskiK @stormwater_jo @RussellB1ggs @PJennings88 @EnvAgency @Ofwat @riverstrust @Thames21 @theriverstrust Hey all- the data can be downloaded as a spatial dataset or spreadsheet from here https://t.co/bVILLZCbUo

@beckett_hayley @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @Cap_it_off @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @PHE_uk Absolutely awful, they're all tucked up in their beds, while we suffer, not sorting anything otherwise we'd be offered emergency accommodation where we can breathe clean air, & send the bill to @RedIndustries2, it's not OK to live like this.

We can’t breathe upstairs. We received a letter today from the @EnvAgency after suffering since we moved here in 2016 - it feels like a kick in the teeth that it’s taken this long for the EA to do anything. In the pocket of Red #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk

urls.title: Can England’s water companies clean up its dirty rivers?
urls.description: Critics blame insufficient capital expenditure since privatisation and a system that allows sewage to be dumped into waterways

tweets.text: It brings to mind an article published by a former colleague @gillplimmer1 in July 2019 about the rising pollution in England's rivers. You can read it here https://t.co/uv90KTwSqb

@EleanorO16 @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency Please share this with as many as you can Petition: Review the Regulation of Odour Management of Landfill Sites
https://t.co/nKxQtLpRDb

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe The presence of high levels of hydrogen sulphide demonstrates incomplete gas capture. Since methane is a considerably more potent greenhouse gas than carbon dioxide, it is environmentally favourable to capture and burn it. Literally better to #StopTheStink

Read our latest update for #WalleysQuarry landfill site here 👉https://t.co/o558iAVicn

We're visiting the surrounding area on an almost daily basis to carry out odour amenity checks. We're also continuing to inspect the site, including monitoring the progress of the capping. https://t.co/FsLQlvsU0f
